Hi Aaron,
The Court has entered our proposed Agreed Order on extending all deadlines in the case by using a reference date of January 1, 2023.
Attached are records we recently received from Norton Orthopedic. Based upon our previous discussions, it appears your client's last treatment was December 16, 2021. Please advise if she does continue any fall-related treatment.
Next, as you had previously advised that your client was making a claim for impairment of her ability to earn money in the future, we will need her tax returns as requested in discovery. We are missing returns for the years 2016, 2018, and 2020. Please provide those to me as soon as possible.
Lastly, once you have had an opportunity to review the new deadlines, give me a call to let me know what your thoughts are with regard to setting the case for mediation.
Thank you,
Betsy R. Catron

Hi Aaron,
The Court has entered our proposed Agreed Order on extending all deadlines in the case by using a reference date of January 1, 2023.
Attached are records we recently received from Norton Orthopedic. Based upon our previous discussions, it appears your client's last treatment was December 16, 2021. Please advise if she does continue any fall-related treatment.
Next, as you had previously advised that your client was making a claim for impairment of her ability to earn money in the future, we will need her tax returns as requested in discovery. We are missing returns for the years 2016, 2018, and 2020. Please provide those to me as soon as possible.
Lastly, once you have had an opportunity to review the new deadlines, give me a call to let me know what your thoughts are with regard to setting the case for mediation.
Thank you,

On Fri, 19 Aug 2022 11:08:15 -0400, Amy Mills emailed Sarena Tuttle:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019

__Re: Update__
CC:
Well I’m glad that you all were able to get the ppp loan info - (that by
the way since I am no longer at all in business will have to pay bk bc they
went off of 2019 tax year and I also was able to get more ppp but was not
sure if I would medically be able to be healed in time to continue)
I do not feel however it is anything to the defense or should have been
entered into my case at all!
Not only that I have not been given an updated report for the FCE or
findings.
I also feel they are reaching trying to find anything at all they can to
somehow get out of paying as much as possible! I still have an MRI report
that states I have a current acute tear in my arm but are unable to get the
doctors on the same page to get treatment! I also want to make sure that
they are responsible for medical malpractice where I was miss diagnosed
upon initial treatment to the ER and it prolonged treatment pain and
suffering bc that would not have happened had had the ancient not occured
in the first place! This has been going on almost 4 years and I’m still
having days I can’t get out of bed and migraines so bad that I feel like
I’m dying! All I really get is medication and continued symptoms but never
any remedy to the problem.

On Fri, 19 Aug 2022 11:35:50 -0400, Sarena Tuttle emailed Amy Mills:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Re: Update__
CC:
I understand your concerns. Please understand that the defense is entitled
to know whether you recovered lost wages during your recovery and if so,
from whom. Since you did receive a PPP loan to cover lost wages, my
understanding is that the Defense will not be responsible for those 'lost
wages' as they were not 'lost' since you did receive them. They most likely
will have to subrogate, meaning reimburse Hometown Bank for the funds
provided. However, I will forward your email to Aaron for him to address
further.
Please find attached a copy of the FCE Report received on 08/16/2022. I
apologize it was not sent sooner.
Sarena M. Tuttle
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104
E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com

On Mon, 22 Aug 2022 14:10:26 +0000, Betsy Catron emailed Aaron Whaley:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Amy Mills v. Forcht Bank__
CC:
Hi Aaron,
I wanted to follow up on a few things in this case. We requested records and bills from Ms. Mills' Norton providers as it was our understanding that she underwent an MRI at the end of May. None of those providers have any records for recent treatment for her. We are still waiting on her records and bills from Baptist Health Corbin. We will provide copies of those to you upon receipt. Please advise if there is any other recent medical treatment of Ms. Mills.
Further, you had previously advised of a FCE occurring in late July. Did this occur as planned? What are your thoughts on when you will be able to get us a demand?
We have also requested your client's tax returns for 2016, 2018 and 2020 several times. The lack of this information significantly limits our ability to evaluate her future earning impairment claim. We also need to know the last day that Bella Beauty was in business.
If you have any questions or would like to discuss the above in further detail, please do not hesitate to contact me.
Thank you,
Betsy R. Catron

On Wed, 24 Aug 2022 12:20:10 -0400, Sarena Tuttle emailed Amy Mills:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Re: Update__
CC:
Good morning Amy,
 Essentially the report stated that you are able to perform sedentary
work. Sedentary work is basically low level physical work that involves
mostly sitting, some walking/standing on occasions and nothing that
requires lifting over 10lbs. The report acknowledges that while you are
limited in the work you do, you are able to perform jobs that are not
physical in nature, examples would be a desk job or running your business
(handline paperwork) while employees actually perform the services.
 Aaron has set up an evaluation with an economist to help determine the
financial impact these restrictions will have. Once we hear from the
economist, we will update you in further detail.
 However, we are still awaiting your tax documents from 2016 & 2017 as
well as the official date that Bella Beauty closed its doors. We understand
that your equipment and products are still in your location and you still
have possession of the location, however, we need the date of the last
services performed. We also understand your concern with providing all this
financial information but as we explained it is required in order to
determine the proper amount of compensation you should receive.
 If you do not have the tax documents in your possession, please reach
out to the IRS and/or your tax preparer and obtain copies as soon as
possible. If you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
Sarena M. Tuttle
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104

Well that really technically is not true bc I was laid up in the bed for
two days after that appointment and I messaged Aaron
The doctor also got the dominant hand wrong!
I am left hand dominant not right!!!
The pain level I told him when I left was like an 8 and I did not see that
on the report!
I couldn’t hardly stand or sit before I left there!!
And NOTHING about the chronic migraine was taken into account!
I am barely able to even leave my home and I can’t run my business bc it is
a teaching institute for one and there isn’t anyone qualified to do that
but me! And that business is bankrupt!
So there is that!
How am I suppose to work when I can barely even wright my Name!!!
Not to mention I can’t remember things get things mixed up from the head
injury and so on!
I had to have someone drive me to the appointment!
I have a masters degree and have worked so hard to build a life that was
taken from me!
Now they want me to work a desk job that they say I physically can do
without taking into consideration of acute debilitating migraines and
further love in more hell bc no one really cares bc it isn’t their life!

I got hurt and went through the motions with hopes of getting better and
not taking on anything else as work bc I couldn’t physically do it (if I
could have I would have not lost my business I worked my ass off to build!)
I tried my absolute hardest on that test!
I have told exactly what has happened!
Been honest to the best of my ability to the accuracy that I can mentally
recall
I have had to depend on everyone for everything! They are the ones that
need to be under a microscope on why they were not doing what they needed
to be doing and bc they were not why I got treated at the bank like I did
when I got hurt
On Thu, Aug 25, 2022 at 2:29 PM Amy Mills wrote:

> I couldn’t hardly stand or sit before I left there!!
> And NOTHING about the chronic migraine was taken into account!
> I am barely able to even leave my home and I can’t run my business bc it
> is a teaching institute for one and there isn’t anyone qualified to do that
> but me! And that business is bankrupt!
> So there is that!
> How am I suppose to work when I can barely even wright my Name!!!
> Not to mention I can’t remember things get things mixed up from the head
> injury and so on!
> I had to have someone drive me to the appointment!
> I have a masters degree and have worked so hard to build a life that was
> taken from me!
> Now they want me to work a desk job that they say I physically can do
> without taking into consideration of acute debilitating migraines and
> further love in more hell bc no one really cares bc it isn’t their life!

>> limited in the work you do, you are able to perform jobs that are not
>> physical in nature, examples would be a desk job or running your business
>> (handline paperwork) while employees actually perform the services.
>> Aaron has set up an evaluation with an economist to help determine

__Fwd: Appt update__
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amy Mills
To: Aaron Whaley
I went to the appt yesterday for the orthopedic specialist and I have been
down all day in so much pain! Like literally in tears! He is scheduling me
for 6 weeks of PT and if that doesn’t have any change then another surgery
will be required! I’m in terrible constant pain and it is not getting
any better and he said that I have scar tissue build up also. The scar
tissue is from prolonged treatment. One bc of the severity of the injuries
with my head and neck and another reason is due to that initial visit to
the ER, where his report was muscle “strain” but the actual test results
from the ER preformed that day showed injuries.
Just a quick update on where we are at.
Thanks,
Amy Mills

means it’s fighting infection - I asked JP abt it and he said the best he
could remember it was a bad sinus infection and that I get them every
spring (I don’t remember bc I don’t remember a whole lot)
Buy I’m pretty sure it is impossible to be knocked out cold (have a knot in
my hair on the left side of my head, which has a sensitive bone like knot
on it still to this day) and have bladder incontinent’s, vomiting, lose
space and time for days without memory, wake up unable to move, clothes are
wet from the water in the floor, and injuries sustained that I have and NOT
have blunt force trauma to the head. (It just doesn’t add up)
Also the way the foyer is set up it’s a small space with a bench in there.
I talked to Jp about the ER visit and he said the only thing that was in
question was if I hit my head on the floor or the bench and if I had hit my
head on the bench did I also hit my neck on the bench - and that idk 1,000
percent bc like I said it knocked me out/ unconscious!
On Fri, Jan 13, 2023 at 3:49 PM Aaron Whaley
wrote:
> What Ortho did you see? I have sent your records to a medical reviewer to
> see what the best case from a medical standpoint we can make to say your
> migraines are the result of the fall. I should have that review back in the
> next two weeks.
>
> On Fri, Jan 13, 2023 at 3:41 PM Amy Mills wrote:
>
>> I went to the appt yesterday for the orthopedic specialist and I have
>> been down all day in so much pain! Like literally in tears! He is
>> scheduling me for 6 weeks of PT and if that doesn’t have any change then
>> another surgery will be required! I’m in terrible constant pain and it is
>> not getting any better and he said that I have scar tissue build up also.
>> The scar tissue is from prolonged treatment. One bc of the severity of the
>> injuries with my head and neck and another reason is due to that initial
>> visit to the ER, where his report was muscle “strain” but the actual test
>> results from the ER preformed that day showed injuries.
>> Just a quick update on where we are at.
>> Thanks,
>> Amy Mills
>> On Tue, Jan 10, 2023 at 11:17 AM Amy Mills wrote:
>>
>>> I have but it has been difficult bc the last month and a week or so I
>>> have been down like 15 days with a migraine where I couldn’t do anything at
>>> all
>>> Ya know Jp has to help me almost all the time
>>> They don’t wanna consider me married but they don’t consider the stuff
>>> of being a single mom (can’t have it both ways)
>>> I have what is labeled and documented in my medical records as “suicide
>>> migraines” From the TBI and without the head injury it is bad but with it -
>>> that’s why I have not went to work or done anything else bc it is in
>>> control of everything in my life!
>>> I have talked with someone (off record) about my situation that makes
>>> has approved and denied disability cases
>>> And in their opinion I would actually qualify as disability and the
>>> stuff from the doctor and the economist was not taken into Acct with my
>>> head
>>> The nurse report we discussed - 1 she isn’t a doctor and if they want to
>>> take nurse over physician we can go there
>>> Not only that the nurse from that visit was from the ER visit where they
>>> told me I was fine and my report said something different
>>> I was throwing up
>>> Couldn’t have a conversation with anyone
>>> Lost a lot of space and time (days!) that I don’t remember
>>> The malpractice of prolonging treatment bc their report said I was fine
>>> but the scans and the radiology report that he SHOULD HAVE based his
>>> diagnosis on said everything and showed the injuries
>>> My primary physician has stated multiple times that bc of that visit it
>>> has caused prolonged treatment and complications!
>>> I am stuck with this for the rest of my life
>>> This should have never happened and after it happened I have video that
>>> it was raining and they did it again! No rugs no signs
>>> Clearly negligent 100 percent
>>> Bobby the lady from the band stated me her and multiple people have fell
>>> their
>>> They knew it was an issue
>>> This could have been completely avoided!
>>> At this point - Criminal!
>>>

Amy,
I'm a bit confused. You said you were attaching information but the only
thing attached are 2 screenshots of your emails with Celia.
As explained previously, Celia is no longer with us & unfortunately, I'm
not privy to the contents or context of any conversation you had with her.
I will only accept requested documents as they are needed & do not see
where this information was saved to your file.
You stated in your deposition that you received training, education, etc in
substance abuse, behavioral and/or mental health counseling, this is what
'new skills' is referring to. Your skills as a counselor instead of
beautician/cosmetologist.
Please send the requested information as soon as possible, we understand
that it may take you a day or two to gather everything together. Please
start with sending us a list/resume of any counseling related work you have
done with dates & amount/method of compensation. We do not need educational
material, we need to know who you have worked for, volunteered for,
completed internships with.
Sarena M. Tuttle

Workers' Compensation Case Manager
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222

being requested multiple times that I have previously sent and have been
lost or misplaced somehow during the switching of hands. I ran across an
email that I will attach a note of that has daily notes of working at the
Trillium Center (inpatient and outpatient facility for adolescents and
adults)
It has my supervisor, her CV/Resume, copies of licensure, scheduled
sessions and activities, among other information pertaining to this
requests and information for past discussions of merit.
Anytime I have came across any documents or something that may Or possibly
may not even be needed in my case I have forwarded it on to the law office,
just for the purpose that I can not remember and recall things at prompted
needed times! This due to the TBI/Nerve damage (depending on which
doctor/physician reports on this topic) sustained from the injuries in this
case.
The reason I am again pointing this out is because I am look through
(hopefully) all saved, sent emails to gather documents for the requested
information.
This was also one month of what was required for 2 years of my master’s
curriculum, which circles back around to the content and context of the
first email response I sent stating that this was already sent in
previously.
I’m trying to forward you separately this exact email in the attachments.

At this point this is a very difficult task after the amount of time that

case.

documentation of information in regards to my case it should be filed in my
file for present or possible future use.

worker, and certified counselor/therapist, training and education, and/or
all of the above list originates.

in the information requested multiple times as I sent screen shots as proof
of time/date stamps of that information- even before the deposit
took place, regarding said Information! To that I am trying to search any
saved emails with documents to re-forward this information. I have no
control over how my information in stored, transferred, or otherwise for my
case within the law firm. However, I am and have been transparent and
forthcoming about any and all information.
As I have previously discussed with Aaron on discovery/disclosure that’s
why I send everything because I don’t know what may or may not be important
or pertinent to my case and by not doing so how is he completely aware of
what he needs to request from me.
For example:
A confusing contradictory point as stated in your last email is the
statement “we do not need educational material” but the internship material
is exactly that.
The confusion could be, as I’m speculating, that what practical and
clinical applications were required in my educational studies and programs
to obtain the degrees and certifications on file.
This will take some time for me to gather as stated previously, for the
reasons stated previously.
I hope this clarifies things better.
Amy Mills

episode_body:
On Thu, 4 May 2023 09:07:40 -0400, Amy Mills emailed Sarena Tuttle:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Re: Your Personal Injury Claim - New Request for Information__
CC:
I wanted to email you to let you know a little snippet of things I deal
with on the daily that never is discussed and I feel gets over looked
The attachment is what took me hours to do from concentration, ability to
sit/stand rotation, ability to type, my ability to see/read without the
words becoming blurry and separating on the page. After which my child
needed me to write a school excuse where he was out sick and to sign a
permission slip - AND I COULDN’T EVEN DO THAT! I had to get someone else to
write it and sign my name bc I couldn’t even hold the pen (bc I’m left
handed) from complete numbness, sharp electric Zapps, muscle spasms, just
from doing this one task that I attached that took hours/all afternoon!
The frustration comes from these types of unspoken struggles that should
not be happening! And yes all this is from this accident! And at first
glance when looking at me you wouldn’t think anything but unless you are
with me every second of the day I can’t get anyone to understand and I try
to hide it because I’m so sick of people simply asking 24/7 - “are you
okay?”
Or hot always have multiple doctors looking at the exact same scans
(without my report or input! Just scans and test results) and all give a
different and sometimes conflicting report of diagnosis! How is someone
suppose to get the correct treatment if non of the doctors and specialists
can agree on the same pictures!
4 years of this and everything that comes from cause and effect…. I wish it
had never ever happened!!!! It is beyond frustrating
Thank you for viewing this I just wanted to let you know as a way of maybe
letting you see some insight. Something that shouldn’t be a big deal to
do/type and it was such an ordeal that causes mental stress, physical
stress, and pressure on me and my family! Yes, this is absolutely INSANE
but my reality I continue to work with everyday.
I feel I needed to send you this as clarification I suppose even though
it’s hard to even talk about and acknowledge out loud.
(I will send the completed document, I’m going to have someone to help me
put this together as soon as possible)
Thank you,
Amy Mills

On Thu, 4 May 2023 10:53:57 -0400, Sarena Tuttle emailed Bellabeautyinstitute:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Re: Your Personal Injury Claim - New Request for Information__
Cc: [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com) Aaron Whaley, [AmyMillsPremiseZ995806@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:AmyMillsPremiseZ995806@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com) Amy Mills Premise 04/26/2019
Good morning Amy,
 Thank you for the email, unfortunately nothing was attached. I also
wish you did not have to go through this and understand that not all
conditions are evident on the outside. I understand that you are human and
are suffering from so much more than just a physical injury. This was a
life changing event that will have a lasting effect not only physically but
also mentally, emotionally, financially & spiritually. We are not trying to
make this more difficult than it has to be, if we were able to get this
information any other way we would. We understand that completing task can
have varying difficulties and try to give you as much time to complete them
as the court will allow. We know that you would like to get this matter
resolved and be able to move forward without all these reminders of what
happened. Unfortunately, in order to resolve the matter and make sure we
are able to get you everything we can, we have to ask for information.
Currently, the Defense is asking for this employment history and we can not
move forward until we receive it, however, we understand that it may take
you a couple of days to gather the information. As I explained, let's
breakdown the information requested and start with just a list of places
where you provided counseling/social work services. From there we can be
more assistive with gathering the more detailed information the Defense is
wanting. We are here to help you and are willing to do anything to help a
long the way.
Sarena M. Tuttle
Litigation Paralegal &
Workers' Compensation Case Manager
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104
E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com
(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS)

If you have received this email in error, please delete it from your system without copying it, and notify the sender by reply email, so that our records can be corrected. Thank you.

On Thu, 1 Jun 2023 16:56:11 -0400, Amy Mills emailed Sarena Tuttle:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Re: Your Personal Injury Claim - New Request for Information__
CC:
Hey Serena,
I have had a lot of issues and it has been very difficult to find my stuff
and go through it in storage
Today I had to have a root canal done unexpectedly but I will be sending
what I have to you in the next 24 hours.
I hope nothing has been left out as I have expressed I do not want to do
anything wrong.
Just wanted to send a quick update.
Thank You,
Amy Mills
On Thu, May 4, 2023 at 10:54 AM Sarena Tuttle
wrote:
> Good morning Amy,
> Thank you for the email, unfortunately nothing was attached. I also
> wish you did not have to go through this and understand that not all
> conditions are evident on the outside. I understand that you are human and
> are suffering from so much more than just a physical injury. This was a
> life changing event that will have a lasting effect not only physically but
> also mentally, emotionally, financially & spiritually. We are not trying to
> make this more difficult than it has to be, if we were able to get this
> information any other way we would. We understand that completing task can
> have varying difficulties and try to give you as much time to complete them
> as the court will allow. We know that you would like to get this matter
> resolved and be able to move forward without all these reminders of what
> happened. Unfortunately, in order to resolve the matter and make sure we
> are able to get you everything we can, we have to ask for information.
> Currently, the Defense is asking for this employment history and we can not
> move forward until we receive it, however, we understand that it may take
> you a couple of days to gather the information. As I explained, let's
> breakdown the information requested and start with just a list of places
> where you provided counseling/social work services. From there we can be
> more assistive with gathering the more detailed information the Defense is
> wanting. We are here to help you and are willing to do anything to help a
> long the way.
>
> Sarena M. Tuttle
> Litigation Paralegal &
> Workers' Compensation Case Manager
> The Whaley Law Firm
> 712 Lyndon Lane
>
> Louisville, KY 40222
>
> D: (502) 357-9971
> O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104
> E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com
> (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS)
>
>
> On Thu, May 4, 2023 at 9:07?AM Amy Mills
> wrote:
>
>> I wanted to email you to let you know a little snippet of things I deal
>> with on the daily that never is discussed and I feel gets over looked
>> The attachment is what took me hours to do from concentration, ability to
>> sit/stand rotation, ability to type, my ability to see/read without the
>> words becoming blurry and separating on the page. After which my child
>> needed me to write a school excuse where he was out sick and to sign a
>> permission slip - AND I COULDN’T EVEN DO THAT! I had to get someone else to
>> write it and sign my name bc I couldn’t even hold the pen (bc I’m left
>> handed) from complete numbness, sharp electric Zapps, muscle spasms, just
>> from doing this one task that I attached that took hours/all afternoon!
>> The frustration comes from these types of unspoken struggles that should
>> not be happening! And yes all this is from this accident! And at first
>> glance when looking at me you wouldn’t think anything but unless you are
>> with me every second of the day I can’t get anyone to understand and I try
>> to hide it because I’m so sick of people simply asking 24/7 - “are you
>> okay?”
>> Or hot always have multiple doctors looking at the exact same scans
>> (without my report or input! Just scans and test results) and all give a
>> different and sometimes conflicting report of diagnosis! How is someone
>> suppose to get the correct treatment if non of the doctors and specialists
>> can agree on the same pictures!
>> 4 years of this and everything that comes from cause and effect…. I wish
>> it had never ever happened!!!! It is beyond frustrating
>> Thank you for viewing this I just wanted to let you know as a way of
>> maybe letting you see some insight. Something that shouldn’t be a big deal
>> to do/type and it was such an ordeal that causes mental stress, physical
>> stress, and pressure on me and my family! Yes, this is absolutely INSANE
>> but my reality I continue to work with everyday.
>> I feel I needed to send you this as clarification I suppose even though
>> it’s hard to even talk about and acknowledge out loud.
>> (I will send the completed document, I’m going to have someone to help me
>> put this together as soon as possible)
>> Thank you,
>> Amy Mills
>>
>> On Wed, May 3, 2023 at 3:11 PM Sarena Tuttle

On Thu, 6 Jul 2023 10:20:21 -0400, Bryce Koon emailed Bellabeautyinstitute:

Case: Amy-Mills-Premise-04-26-2019
Client: Amy Mills
__Questions from Defense__
Cc: [AmyMillsPremiseZ995806@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:AmyMillsPremiseZ995806@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com)
Good morning Ms. Mills,
Below are just a couple of questions from the defense that I do not easily have the answers to and were hoping you could help:
Names and addresses of each person or organization where you have worked or interned in the areas of Substance Abuse, Behavioral Disorder and Mental Health Counseling, worked as a LPCA (Licensed Professional Counselor Associate), or worked toward a LPC (Licensed Professional Counselor) designation.
For each person and/or organization above, please state
The dates of each such employment, practicum, or internship; The nature of the work or duties; The place or places where such work or duties were performed; The names and telephone numbers of any supervisors for each employment, practicum, or internship; andThe average weekly or monthly compensation from such employment, practicum, or internship.
Please provide copies of any applications for any employment or internships above, the date of the applications, and the result of the application.
Any other documents which relate in any way to the above question(s).
Thank you!
W. Bryce Koon, Esq.The Whaley Law Firm 712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222Phone: (502) 365-5043Fax: (502) 237-3207

Good morning Amy,
 Please find the Zoom Link for your mediation below. As we have
discussed, your mediation will take place on September 21, 2023 at 9:00a.m.
Eastern Time.
 This will be your opportunity to discuss your claim with a former
circuit court judge and the Defense Counsel. The Mediator will review a
summary of the evidence, listen to both sides and their current position.
He will then provide insight into how he feels the claim should be
resolved. His opinions are not final and simply a tool to help with
deciding whether to move forward with trial or to attempt settlement.
 If the Defense is willing, you may possibly settle your claim if a
mutual agreement is reached. If not, the claim will move forward to Trial.
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss
them in further detail.
Time: Sep 21, 2023 09:00 AM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

__Migraine info__
Amy, the Dr. at Norton Neurology Services, is Dr. Alsorogi. The other
client that I was talking about had had a cervical fusion like you and then
had persistent, intractable migraines. What ultimately worked best for her
was a medication called Aimovig (140 mg/mL). It is a once-monthly
injection. She was also prescribed Maxalt to take as needed if a migraine
did start.
https://www.aimovig.com/
--

Amy, has the MRI been rescheduled? I need this done so that I can send this
to an expert and we can see if you need to have a revision surgery done and
we can see if possibly your neck is what’s causing your headaches. If we
can rule out the neck for your headaches then you can move on to treatment
for the headaches, and again the experts, can offer an opinion. We need to
do this if we’re going to get to the numbers that you want in this case.
Also, at this point, the longer we wait the worse it becomes if we are at
trial. I need to push the defense for trial with this additional
information to get a better outcome but I can’t do that until I have the
information.

wrote:
> Aaron,
> I was called yesterday to schedule the MrI (it is scheduled for this
> Saturday 1/6/2024) \\Trust that no one wants this done more than I do! I
> have been dealing with the agony from the injury and I can not rush it any
> faster or I would already have this taken care of! There wasn't a Christmas
> for my kids because of these issues! I also have a botched root canal (that
> is what the dentists told me) the filling has completely gave way and my
> tooth is exposed - extraction is also not an option because of my neck
> injury and the issues with that so it will need to be
> surgically removed!!!!!!
>
> The other thing with the amount they offer is an insult! The 4 months of
> 2019 before I was hurt was twice as much(plus) as the annual income
> estimate! The tax returns show this but in the end it was a loss from not
> working for the rest of the year! Jason has already made the offer and then
> some as a owner/op truck driver for the 4+ years the case has been going
> on. if you google his salary for his specialized hazard pay for KY it says
> $84k, when in reality he does one contract a month he makes that!
>
> Medical Mal- the failure to diagnose and prolonged treatment from the ER
> initial visit
> TBI
> and a possible failed spinal fusion
> During the back and forth negotiations the fact their lawyer would not
> even go back with a higher offer was another thing (which I am sure the
> licensing and insurance board would frown upon)
>
> Also, as a side note to the appt on saturday- if we get the
> forecasted snow we are expected to have I will not be continuing that
> appointment because of safety concerns. Call it PTSD, anxiety, or whatever
> but I can not risk it and have to be super cautious for my safety and risk
> of potential future harm.
> I will keep you posted!
>
>

information attached as well, as Dr. Orlando and I often work together on
catastrophic cases where an IME and LCP are needed. We work jointly and
also individually.

available for a phone call:
March 28 anytime 11-4pm
March 29 9am
April 1 10-2pm
April 2 10-4pm

AI Summary:
Reviewing activity in Amy Mills Premise 04/26/2019 between 12/25/2024 and 1/24/2025...

This case involves Amy Mills suing Forcht Bank, likely for a fall incident that occurred in 2019. The plaintiff has ongoing medical issues and treatments related to the incident, including shoulder problems requiring surgery.
The most recent activity shows that the defendant filed a Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions on January 7, 2025, which was scheduled for a hearing on January 13, 2025. (See details)
A potential red flag is that the plaintiff's discovery responses were deemed deficient by the defense, particularly regarding the disclosure of new medical providers and upcoming surgery information. This led to the Motion for Contempt. (See details)
The next steps should include gathering and providing updated medical information, particularly about Dr. Kevin Magone in London, KY, who is treating the plaintiff, and details about the postponed January 3rd surgery. This information should be promptly shared with the defense to address the discovery issues. (See details), (See details)

__Summary of the call with lfarah@whtlaw.com__
Hi
Here's the summary of the call with lfarah@whtlaw.com at 2/24 01:04 PM
(UTC-05:00):
Betsy and Aaron discussed the client's ongoing medical issues and the
challenges in negotiating a settlement due to her persistent pain and
upcoming surgery.
Recap
 * Betsy reached out to Aaron to discuss the client's situation and
potential settlement negotiations.
 * Aaron informed Betsy that the client had surgery scheduled for January
3rd, which was canceled due to weather, and she has been unwell recently.
 * The client is still experiencing pain and has not been able to engage in
settlement discussions.
 * Aaron mentioned that the client is unlikely to lower her settlement
demand of $1.5 million due to her ongoing pain and medical issues.
 * Betsy suggested obtaining the most recent medical records to assess the
situation and keep track of expenses.
 * They agreed to stay updated on the client's surgery timeline to better
understand the case's progression.
Tasks
 * Aaron needs to send the most recent medical records to Betsy this week.
 * Aaron should keep Betsy informed about the client's surgery schedule as
it develops.
Best,
aaron whaley

Email Content:
Lauren,
Amy still has not responded to any of my phone calls or emails. Can you please do this letter to her to be sent via US mail with a self-addressed stamped envelope
RE Amy Mills v. Forcht Bank
Dear Ms. Mills,
Before any medical providers will talk with us about your injuries and treatment they require a signed HIPAA authorization. Please sign the enclosed HIPAA authorization and return it to us in the enclosed self-addressed stamped envelope. We also need to set up a time to talk about your case, a second mediation, an independent medical examination, and other steps that need to be taken to keep your case moving forward. Please respond to the e-mail chain with some dates and times that you would be available to talk. As I stated in a recent e-mail, I will be in town for an inspection of the bank on Wednesday October 29, 2025. If you would like to meet before or after that inspection that would be fantastic.
Cordially by me
Enclosures: HIPAA authorization
